text: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
author: Steve Martin

text: Always borrow money from a pessimist.  He won't expect it back.
author: Anonymous

text: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Do not take life too seriously.  You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I love deadlines.  I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Procastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
author: Don Marquis

text: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: If you are naturally kind, you attract a lot of people you don't like.
author: William Feather

text: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
author: Mae West

text: If at first you don't succeed... So much for skydiving.
author: Henny Youngman

text: Only the mediocre are always at their best.
author: Jean Giraudoux

text: I hate housework! You make the beds, you do the dishes, and six months later you have to start all over again.
author: Joan Rivers

text: The tax collector must love poor people - he's creating so many of them.
author: Bill Vaughan

text: Never put a sock in a toaster.
author: Eddie Izzard

text: If you live to be one hundred you've got it made. Very few people die past that age.
author: George Burns

text: The only time I ever enjoyed ironing was the day I accidentally got gin in the steam iron.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: I have a new philosophy.  I'm only going to dread one day at a time.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: Progress was all right.  Only it went on too long.
author: James Thurber

text: I distrust camels - and anyone else who can go a week without a drink.
author: Joe E. Lewis

text: My dog is worrid about the economy because Alpo is up to $3 a can.  That's almost $21 in dog money.
author: Joe Weinstein

text: I wear a necklace 'cause I wanna know when I'm upside down.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: I was born in verry sorry circumstances.  Both of my parents were very sorry.
author: Norman Wisdom

text: Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly.
author: P.J. O'Rourke

text: The reason there are two senators for each state is so that one can be the designated driver.
author: Jay Leno

text: Man cannot live by bread alone; he must also have peanut butter.
author: James A. Garfield

text: Be thankful we're not gettign all the government we're paying for.
author: Will Rogers

text: Children are smarter than any of us.  Know how I know that? I don't know one child with a full-time job and children.
author: Bill Hicks

text: I always wanted to be somebody.  Now I realize that I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: If it's the Psychic Network why do they need a phone number?
author: Robin Willilams

text: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?
author: Phyllis Diller

text: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.
author: Mark Twain

text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
author: Winnie the Pooh

text: Just remember - if the world didn't suck, we'd all fall off.
author: Unknown

text: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you, but not the one ahead.
author: Bill McGlashen

text: I have enough money to live comfortably for the rest of my life; if I die next Tuesday.
author: Unknown

text: Silence is golden; duct tape is silver.
author: Anonymous

text: If life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade...  And then try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka and have a party.
author: Ron White

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend.  Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Never raise your hand to your children - it leaves your midsection unprotected.
author: Robert Orben

text: I have not failed.  I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: I'm against picketing, but I don't know how to show it.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
author: Rita Rudner

text: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you.  This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.
author: Mark Twain

The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.
author: Charles de Gaulle
